verses.roman:
śrī-śuka uvāca
tasyāṁ sa pāñcajanyāṁ vai
viṣṇu-māyopabṛṁhitaḥ
haryaśva-saṁjñān ayutaṁ
putrān ajanayad vibhuḥ

synonyms: śrī-śukaḥ uvāca—Śrī Śukadeva Gosvāmī said; tasyām—in her; saḥ—Prajāpati Dakṣa; pāñcajanyām—his wife named Pāñcajanī; vai—indeed; viṣṇu-māyā-upabṛṁhitaḥ—being made capable by the illusory energy of Lord Viṣṇu; haryaśva-saṁjñān—named the Haryaśvas; ayutam—ten thousand; putrān—sons; ajanayat—begot; vibhuḥ—being powerful.
translation: Śrīla Śukadeva Gosvāmī continued: Impelled by the illusory energy of Lord Viṣṇu, Prajāpati Dakṣa begot ten thousand sons in the womb of Pāñcajanī [Asiknī]. My dear King, these sons were called the Haryaśvas.
